result.execSummary:
The defendant Nicholas R. Baum was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Encouraging Parole/Probation Violation, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.46.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation is discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil Judgment will be entered against the Defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Per Wisconsin Statute, funds from prison accounts may be used for obligations in accordance with prison policy not to exceed 25% of gross.
Obtain and maintain full-time employment or be enrolled in and attend school full time, or a combination of both resulting in full time.

Comply wtith any and all reporting requirements.
Participate in any counseling as recommended by the agent.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Nicholas R. Baum

14A 028163 (balance of bond applied to 14CT142)
Statement Regarding Recusal - Molepski, Jr/Judge Finn

Defendant Nicholas R. Baum in court with attorney Anne Renc. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Cases heard are 14CF-56 and 14CT-142.

10:47 AM Court calls cases.
Atty Knaapen states appearances.

There is a plea agreement.

14CF-56 State has filed an amended information.
Defendant will plead to this amended charge

14CT-142: Defendant will plead to single charge

Atty Renc concurs with the agreement, this is a joint recommendation.

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.

Defendant enters a plea of: NO CONTEST 14CF-56 Amended charge
Defendant enters a plea of: NO CONTEST 14CT-142

Court questions Defendant regarding pleas.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.

Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charges.

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charges.
Court finds the defendant guilty.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.
14CF-56 Count 1: 946.46
14CT-142: 346.67(1)

Atty Knaapen makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Atty Renc makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 

Court agrees with the recommendations.

BY THE COURT:
14CF-56:
Sentence is Withheld
Probation for a period of 18 Months
Conditions:
Comply wtith any and all reporting requirements
Participate in any counseling as recommended by the agent
Maintain full time employment or full time schooling or a combination of both to equal full time
Pay a $100 fine plus costs

14CT-142:
Sentence is Withheld
Probation for a period of 18 Months, concurrent to 14CF-56
Conditions:
Comply with conditions of probation as stated in 14CF-56
Pay restitution of $500
Pay restitution surcharge
Pay a $300 fine plus costs

Any bond monies are ordered applied first to restitution, then to fines and costs. Balance to be paid within 60 days.
$100.00 paid on 9-9-14 by receipt 14R 032368.
Plea/sentencing hearing on November 11, 2014 at 10:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on June 30, 2014 at 11:00 am.
